case_title: Dr. S.M. Inkisar Ali vs Government of Sindh and others

accussed_details.name: Dr. S.M. Inkisar Ali
allegation: Dispute over seniority and promotion in BS-20

complaint_summary: Dispute over seniority and promotion between appellant and respondent in BS-20 under Sindh Civil Servants Rules.
investigation_summary: The appellant and respondent were promoted to BS-20 on regular basis in 1996 after fulfilling requisite qualifications. Disputes arose over seniority lists and acting charge promotions.
judgment_summary: The Supreme Court ruled that the appellant was senior to the respondent based on regular promotions and dismissed appeals challenging the seniority list and notifications. Acting charge promotions were deemed temporary and did not confer seniority rights.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal allowed; appellant declared senior to respondent.
legal_arguments: Rule 8-A of Sindh Civil Servants Rules regarding acting charge promotions.
Distinction between regular and acting charge promotions.
Supersession does not apply in acting charge promotions.
statutes: Sindh Civil Servants (Appointment, Promotion and Transfer) Rules, 1974
key_issues: Seniority dispute between appellant and respondent.

legal_terms.Supersession: Being passed over for promotion due to lack of qualifications or other valid reasons.
legal_terms.Acting charge: Temporary promotion to fill a vacancy without conferring seniority rights.

words_and_phrases.Seniority list: A list ranking officers based on their service and qualifications.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around a seniority dispute between Dr. S.M. Inkisar Ali and the Government of Sindh. The Supreme Court clarified the distinction between regular and acting charge promotions, ruling that acting charge promotions do not confer seniority rights. The appellant was declared senior to the respondent based on regular promotions in BS-20.

acting_charge_basis.appellant: Superseded due to lack of qualification
acting_charge_basis.respondent: Promoted despite lack of length of service

seniority_disputes.appellant_action: Filed representation and Appeal No. 35 of 2000
seniority_disputes.result: Notification withdrawn, appellant restored as senior
Notification dated July 31, 2000 upheld, appellant confirmed as senior

tribunal_decisions.remarks: Promotion on acting charge basis does not count toward seniority
Supersession does not carry stigma; appellant confirmed as senior

legal_basis.rules_cited: Sindh Civil Servants (Appointment, Promotion and Transfer) Rules, 1974
key_provisions: Rule 8: Regular promotion requires requisite qualifications and conditions
Rule 8-A: Acting charge basis does not confer seniority or vested rights

advocates: Mr. Abdul Fateh Malik (Additional Advocate General, Sindh)
Mr. Sohail H. K. Rana (Respondent No. 3)
